quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Waves
quiz.subtitle: Unit 8, Quiz 7: Graphical Analysis of Waves
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: Based on the provided graph, how many complete wavelengths are shown between point O and point J?
questions.explanation: The wave completes one full cycle at point W and a second full cycle at point J, where the displacement returns to zero after the second trough.

questions.question: Which distance on the Y-axis represents the amplitude of the wave?
options: The distance from O to Q
The distance from Q to S
The distance from O to T
The distance from S to V
questions.explanation: Amplitude is defined as the maximum displacement from the equilibrium position (the X-axis). This is represented by the vertical distance O-Q (or O-S in magnitude).

questions.question: Which of the following points are currently at their maximum downward acceleration?
questions.explanation: In SHM/Waves, acceleration is greatest at maximum displacement but in the opposite direction. At the crests (T and X), the restoring force and acceleration are at their maximum magnitude pointing downward.

questions.question: If the total horizontal distance from O to J is 20 meters, what is the wavelength of this wave?
questions.explanation: Since there are 2 full wavelengths between O and J, the wavelength (λ) is the total distance divided by the number of cycles: 20m / 2 = 10m.

questions.question: Which pair of points are exactly 180 degrees (or π radians) out of phase?
questions.explanation: Points are 180° out of phase when they are at opposite displacements. T is a crest and V is a trough.

questions.question: What does the point V represent on this transverse wave?
questions.explanation: A trough is the point of maximum negative displacement on a transverse wave.

questions.question: If this wave is moving to the right, what will be the immediate motion of the particle currently at point U?
questions.explanation: As the wave moves right, the crest to the left of U (Point T) will move toward U, causing the particle at U to move upward.

questions.question: Which points on the graph represent the 'equilibrium' positions?
questions.explanation: Equilibrium positions are where the displacement y = 0. These are the points where the wave crosses the X-axis.

questions.question: The distance between point T and point X is equal to:
questions.explanation: The distance between two consecutive crests is defined as one full wavelength (λ).

questions.question: If the frequency of this wave is 5 Hz, what is the period?
questions.explanation: Period is the reciprocal of frequency: T = 1/f = 1/5 = 0.2 seconds.
